segment.source: MED-V 2.0 Best Practices
segment.target: MED-V 2.0 Best Practices

segment.source: MED-V 2.0 Best Practices
segment.target: MED-V 2.0 Best Practices

segment.source: MED-V 2.0 Best Practices
segment.target: MED-V 2.0 Best Practices

segment.source: When you are planning, deploying, and managing MED-V in your enterprise, you may find the best practice recommendations to be useful.
segment.target: When you are planning, deploying, and managing MED-V in your enterprise, you may find the best practice recommendations to be useful.

segment.source: Configure first time setup to run unattended
segment.target: Configure first time setup to run unattended

segment.source: Although you can specify any settings that you prefer, a MED-V best practice is that you create the Sysprep.inf file so that first time setup can be run in Unattended mode.
segment.target: Although you can specify any settings that you prefer, a MED-V best practice is that you create the Sysprep.inf file so that first time setup can be run in Unattended mode.

segment.source: This requires you to provide all the required settings information as you continue through the Setup Manager wizard.
segment.target: This requires you to provide all the required settings information as you continue through the Setup Manager wizard.

segment.source: For more information about how to configure the MED-V image, see Configuring a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V.
segment.target: For more information about how to configure the MED-V image, see Configuring a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V.

segment.source: Disable restore points on the virtual machine
segment.target: Disable restore points on the virtual machine

segment.source: Before you create the MED-V workspace package, we recommend that you disable restore points on the virtual machine to prevent the differencing disk from growing unbounded.
segment.target: Before you create the MED-V workspace package, we recommend that you disable restore points on the virtual machine to prevent the differencing disk from growing unbounded.

segment.source: For more information, see How to turn off and turn on System Restore in Windows XP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195927).
segment.target: For more information, see How to turn off and turn on System Restore in Windows XP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195927).

segment.source: Configure MED-V image to use local profiles
segment.target: Configure MED-V image to use local profiles

segment.source: We recommend that you apply only those policies that make sense in an application compatibility environment for Windows XP.
segment.target: We recommend that you apply only those policies that make sense in an application compatibility environment for Windows XP.

segment.source: For example, desktop customization policies do not typically have to be applied and should be disabled.
segment.target: For example, desktop customization policies do not typically have to be applied and should be disabled.

segment.source: For more information about how to allow only local profiles, see Group Policy Settings for Roaming User Profiles (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=205072).
segment.target: For more information about how to allow only local profiles, see Group Policy Settings for Roaming User Profiles (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=205072).

segment.source: Configure a Group Policy performance update
segment.target: Configure a Group Policy performance update

segment.source: By default, Group Policy is downloaded to a computer one byte at a time.
segment.target: By default, Group Policy is downloaded to a computer one byte at a time.

segment.source: This causes delays when MED-V is being joined to the domain.
segment.target: This causes delays when MED-V is being joined to the domain.

segment.source: To increase the performance of Group Policy, we recommend that you set the following registry key value to the registry:
segment.target: To increase the performance of Group Policy, we recommend that you set the following registry key value to the registry:

segment.source: Registry subkey: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindows NTCurrentVersionWinlogon
segment.target: Registry subkey: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindows NTCurrentVersionWinlogon

segment.source: Entry: BufferPolicyReads
segment.target: Entry: BufferPolicyReads

segment.source: Type: DWORD
segment.target: Type: DWORD

segment.source: Value: 1
segment.target: Value: 1

segment.source: Distribute legal notice through Group Policy instead of in the MED-V image
segment.target: Distribute legal notice through Group Policy instead of in the MED-V image

segment.source: If you want end users to see a service level agreement (SLA) before they access MED-V, we recommend that you enforce the SLA through Group Policy later so that the SLA is displayed to the end user after the first time setup is finished.
segment.target: If you want end users to see a service level agreement (SLA) before they access MED-V, we recommend that you enforce the SLA through Group Policy later so that the SLA is displayed to the end user after the first time setup is finished.

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: Even though a best practice is to run first time setup in Unattended mode, if you decide to set the local policy or registry entry to include an SLA in your image (virtual hard disk), you must also specify that first time setup is run in Attended mode, or first time setup can fail.
segment.target: Even though a best practice is to run first time setup in Unattended mode, if you decide to set the local policy or registry entry to include an SLA in your image (virtual hard disk), you must also specify that first time setup is run in Attended mode, or first time setup can fail.

segment.source: Compact the virtual hard disk
segment.target: Compact the virtual hard disk

segment.source: We recommend that you compact your virtual hard disk to reclaim empty disk space and reduce the size of the virtual hard disk.
segment.target: We recommend that you compact your virtual hard disk to reclaim empty disk space and reduce the size of the virtual hard disk.

segment.source: For more information about how to compact your virtual hard disk, see Compacting the MED-V Virtual Hard Disk.
segment.target: For more information about how to compact your virtual hard disk, see Compacting the MED-V Virtual Hard Disk.

segment.source: Configure virtual machine to restart on blue screen crash
segment.target: Configure virtual machine to restart on blue screen crash

segment.source: We recommend that you configure the MED-V workspace virtual machine to automatically restart when it encounters a blue screen crash.
segment.target: We recommend that you configure the MED-V workspace virtual machine to automatically restart when it encounters a blue screen crash.

segment.source: To configure this setting in the guest, set the AutoReboot value in the HKEYLOCALMACHINESYSTEMCurrentControlSetControlCrashControl key to “1”.
segment.target: To configure this setting in the guest, set the AutoReboot value in the HKEYLOCALMACHINESYSTEMCurrentControlSetControlCrashControl key to “1”.

segment.source: You can also configure this setting by clicking Start, clicking Control Panel, and then clicking System.
segment.target: You can also configure this setting by clicking Start, clicking Control Panel, and then clicking System.

segment.source: Then, in the Startup and Recovery area of the Advanced tab, click Settings.
segment.target: Then, in the Startup and Recovery area of the Advanced tab, click Settings.

segment.source: Select the Automatically restart check box and click OK.
segment.target: Select the Automatically restart check box and click OK.

segment.source: Back up MED-V image before sealing it
segment.target: Back up MED-V image before sealing it

segment.source: We recommend that you create a backup copy of the MED-V image before you seal it.
segment.target: We recommend that you create a backup copy of the MED-V image before you seal it.

segment.source: For more information about sealing your MED-V image, see Configuring a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V.
segment.target: For more information about sealing your MED-V image, see Configuring a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V.

segment.source: Install Windows Virtual PC last when installing from a batch file
segment.target: Install Windows Virtual PC last when installing from a batch file

segment.source: When you install the MED-V components by using a batch file, specify that Windows Virtual PC and the Windows Virtual PC hotfix are installed after the MED-V Host Agent and the MED-V workspace package files.
segment.target: When you install the MED-V components by using a batch file, specify that Windows Virtual PC and the Windows Virtual PC hotfix are installed after the MED-V Host Agent and the MED-V workspace package files.

segment.source: This ensures that Windows Update will not cause any interference with the installation process by requiring a restart.
segment.target: This ensures that Windows Update will not cause any interference with the installation process by requiring a restart.

segment.source: Install MED-V workspace from local folder
segment.target: Install MED-V workspace from local folder

segment.source: Because of problems that can occur when you install MED-V from a network location, we recommend that you copy the MED-V workspace setup files locally and then run setup.exe.
segment.target: Because of problems that can occur when you install MED-V from a network location, we recommend that you copy the MED-V workspace setup files locally and then run setup.exe.

segment.source: Manage printer redirection in one manner only
segment.target: Manage printer redirection in one manner only

segment.source: If a printer is manually installed on the MED-V guest virtual machine, and the same printer is later installed on the host computer, the result is that it is installed two times in the guest.
segment.target: If a printer is manually installed on the MED-V guest virtual machine, and the same printer is later installed on the host computer, the result is that it is installed two times in the guest.

segment.source: To avoid this situation, we recommend as MED-V best practice that you manage printer redirection in one manner only: either disable redirection and install printers manually on the guest, or enable redirection and do not install printers manually on the guest.
segment.target: To avoid this situation, we recommend as MED-V best practice that you manage printer redirection in one manner only: either disable redirection and install printers manually on the guest, or enable redirection and do not install printers manually on the guest.

segment.source: Configure settings for MED-V guest patching
segment.target: Configure settings for MED-V guest patching

segment.source: You can control when and for how long the MED-V virtual machine awakens to receive automatic updates by defining the relevant configuration values in the registry.
segment.target: You can control when and for how long the MED-V virtual machine awakens to receive automatic updates by defining the relevant configuration values in the registry.

segment.source: A MED-V best practice is to set your wake-up interval to match the time when you have scheduled regular updates for MED-V virtual machines.
segment.target: A MED-V best practice is to set your wake-up interval to match the time when you have scheduled regular updates for MED-V virtual machines.

segment.source: In addition, we recommend that you configure these settings to resemble the host computer’s behavior.
segment.target: In addition, we recommend that you configure these settings to resemble the host computer’s behavior.

segment.source: For more information about how to configure settings for MED-V guest patching, see Managing Automatic Updates for MED-V Workspaces.
segment.target: For more information about how to configure settings for MED-V guest patching, see Managing Automatic Updates for MED-V Workspaces.

segment.source: Configure antivirus/backup software
segment.target: Configure antivirus/backup software

segment.source: To prevent antivirus activity from affecting the performance of the virtual desktop, we recommend that when you can, you exclude the following virtual machine file types from any antivirus or backup process that is running on the MED-V host computer:
segment.target: To prevent antivirus activity from affecting the performance of the virtual desktop, we recommend that when you can, you exclude the following virtual machine file types from any antivirus or backup process that is running on the MED-V host computer:

segment.source: .VMC
segment.target: .VMC

segment.source: .VUD
segment.target: .VUD

segment.source: .VSV
segment.target: .VSV

segment.source: .VHD
segment.target: .VHD
